intro: Solidago decurrens, commonly known as the tall goldenrod, is a perennial herb native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems that can grow up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces showy clusters of bright yellow flowers in the late summer and early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Solidago decurrens thrives in moist soils and is often found in wetlands, meadows, and along stream banks.
